text: hello this is chef john from food wishes
comm with crab stuffed deviled eggs
that's right unlike most of the other
recipes that are called crab stuffed
deviled eggs these are actually really
stuffed with crab and just not topped
with crab although they are topped with
crab too so I guess technically we
should call these crab stuffed crab
topped deviled eggs although then the
name would be way too long much like
this intro but anyway these are
extremely easy to make and incredibly
delicious so here we go and step one of
course we're going to need some hard
boiled eggs so what we're going to do is
we're going to take six cold eggs right
from the refrigerator we're going to put
them in a pot and cover them with cold
water we want to make sure they're
covered by at least an inch of water
we're going to place that on high heat
and we're going to wait for it to start
to simmer and at first you'll see little
bubbles form at the bottom and then
those little bubbles will start breaking
up towards the surface and then right
about here you're going to see those
eggs start to dance a little are you see
that starting to move and as soon as
those eggs start to twerk and that pot
starts to boil like that I like to give
it a little swirl I'm not sure why I do
that it's just part of the ritual and
then we're going to quickly turn off the
heat and cover it and we're going to let
that sit there with the heat off for
exactly 17 minutes don't peek
do not touch the cover don't do anything
just wait 17 minutes and once that timer
rings we're going to go over to the sink
we're going to drain out that hot water
carefully just use your lid like that
and then we're going to shock these with
cold water but before we do that a bonus
trick we're going to give them a little
shake to kind of crack those shells a
little bit so put the lid on give them a
little shake a little joselow jiggle
okay so hard enough so those eggs kind
of run into each other kind of crack a
little bit you don't want to do it so
hard to break the eggs open but enough
to at least crack the shell in a few
places on each egg and then we're going
to fill that up with cold water and I'm
going to do that twice
so once I've given them the old cracker
cracker we're going to fill it up with
cold water once I'm going to pour that
water off and then all I'm going to do
is fill that back up with cold water and
just let them sit there until they're
completely cold at which point you can
peel and because those hot eggs had
little cracks when we hit them with the
cold water they say that makes them peel
really easily and I find that to be true
in fact these were really really really
fresh eggs which are notoriously hard to
peel and that shell came off pretty easy
so we're going to peel those eggs
then of course we're going to cut them
in half and please people that said our

out that is just absolutely perfect
no green ring so if you're a chronic

and it's time to proceed with our crap
stuff doubled eggs so of course we're

good thing about this step is you can

of course that's our homemade sriracha
we're also going to give it a few drips

also put a little touch of freshly

and then we'll also put in a little bit

I know all your friends are doing it but

not to mention one of the world's best
